headline: Varney on Biden's Pennsylvania trip: The party is walking away from its leader
sentences: FOX Business' Stuart Varney, during his latest "My Take" on "Varney & Co." Friday, argued President Biden is in "political trouble" as the Democrat Party is "walking away" from its leader.

ELON MUSK SAYS BIDEN TREATS AMERICANS 'LIKE FOOLS' AFTER PRESIDENT MEETS WITH GM, FORD EXECS ON ELECTRIC CARS
STUART VARNEY: The president travels to Pennsylvania today, his home state.
When you turn down a photo-op with a sitting president from your own party, in an election year, you know Biden is in political trouble.
The left doesn't want to be labeled a "Biden Democrat," and "moderates" understand that a "Biden Democrat" is a losing Democrat.
Earlier this month the top Democrat in Georgia refused to attend the president's speech in Atlanta on voting reform.
In Texas, Beto O'Rourke, says he's not interested in getting help for his campaign from "any" Democrat!
If the president can't turn things around, the Democrats will surely lose the House and the Senate.

Afghanistan, inflation, crime, the border, COVID...
It’s their own fault...
Well first off, the president's approval rating is in the tank.
But he's getting the cold shoulder from some top Democrats.
Both were invited to be photographed with the president.
You don't want a photo-op with a failing president.
Stacey Abrams also had a "scheduling conflict."
The party is walking away from its leader.
That’s why 29 House Democrats are leaving!
He's talking up his win on infrastructure.
John Fetterman is running for the Senate.
It is 10 months to the midterm elections.
They say they have scheduling conflicts.
Josh Shapiro is running for governor.
Second, the party is split.
Should be popular.
Both refused.
Why?
